shapes3d

Class Terrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes3d.Shape3D
      • shapes3d.Terrain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PConstants, SConstants

    public class Terrain
extends Shape3D
    A simple terrain class.
    When created the terrain will be centred in the horizontal plane about world position [X=0, Z=0] with terrain height on the Y axis.
    At present this class does not allow the user to move or rotate the terrain, this is to simplify coding of some of the methods and maybe relaxed in later versions.

    In Processing the positive Y direction is down, this is the opposite to OpenGL. This class uses Processing coordinates so the higher the terrain the smaller (more negative the number). This has implications when calculating the height map, and positioning objects relative to the terrain surface. Processing coordinates
    Author:
    Peter Lager

      Simple class to represent a section of the terrain.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Terrain

        public Terrain(PApplet app,
       int gridSlices,
       float terrainSize,
       float horizon)
        Create a square flat terrain.
        The 'real world' size is given by terrainSize. The drawing detail level is given by gridSlices (e.g. gridSlices would be 8 for a chessboard).
        gridSlices must be an even number >= 8 if the value passed does not meet these conditions it is incremented to the next even number >= 8.
        Parameters:
        app -
        gridSlices - must be an even number >= 8 (e.g. 8, 10, 12 etc)
        terrainSize - size in 3D world
        horizon - the visibility limit for drawing wrap round

      • Terrain

        public Terrain(PApplet app,
       int gridSlices,
       float terrainSize,
       float horizon,
       float heightMult,
       float[][] heightMap)
        Create a square terrain using a heightmap.
        The 'real world' size is given by terrainSize. The drawing detail level is given by gridSlices (e.g. gridSlices would be 8 for a chessboard).
        gridSlices must be an even number >= 8 if the value passed does not meet these conditions it is incremented to the next even number >= 8.
        The heights for each vertex is calculated for the value in the heightMap array times the heightMult. This is useful because we can easily create a normalised height map (all values in range 0-1) using perlin noise or similar and then provide a multiply depending on the terrainSize.
        If the size of heightMap array does not match the terrain size then either extra values are ignored or the heightMap is wrapped round the terrain. Useful because if the heightMap is of size [gridSlices][gridslices] the the heights wrap round i.e. heights on the north/south edges and the east/west edges match - useful to when implementing an infinite terrain (my next step).
        Parameters:
        app -
        gridSlices - must be an even number >= 8 (e.g. 8, 10, 12 etc)
        terrainSize - size in 3D world
        heightMult - multiplier for heights in heightMap array
        heightMap - 2D float array representing heights

      • setTexture

        public void setTexture(String fname)
        Set the texture to be used for this Shape (no tiling)
        If the image is loaded successfully then the drawMode is changed to TEXTURE.
        Overrides:
        setTexture in class Shape3D
        Parameters:
        fname - image filename

      • setTexture

        public void setTexture(String fname,
              int textureRepeats)
        Set the texture to be used for this Shape and the number of texture repeats (tiling)
        textureRepeats must be an even number and a factor of gridSlices (as specified in the constructors). If not it will be changed to meet this conditions.
        If the image is loaded successfully then the drawMode is changed to TEXTURE.
        Parameters:
        fname - image filename
        textureRepeats -

      • setTexture

        Set the texture to be used for this Shape (no tiling)
        If the image is loaded successfully then the drawMode is changed to TEXTURE.
        Parameters:
        img - the image to use

      • adjustPosition

        public void adjustPosition(PVector target,
                  int mode)
        Change the positional vector (target) so that its x/z position is over the terrain.
        Use mode = Terrain.CLAMP or Terrain.WRAP to determine whether to force the target to remain over the terrain or wrap to the other side.
        Parameters:
        target - the position to adjust.
        mode - Terrain.CLAMP or Terrain.WRAP

      • getHeight

        public float getHeight(float x,
              float z)
        Calculate the terrain height given a real world position.
        Position must have been 'adjusted' to be over the terrain before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        x -
        z -
        Returns:
        the terrain height (y) for position (x,z)
